headline: President Trump makes waves in the UK
subHeadline: Trump downplays controversial interview with The Sun, talks trade and immigration; reaction on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, just from the start, I don't like the lines. So the security lines, especially, like if it's holiday and you get a lot of people who aren't regular fliers. And they just stand there, like, they want to argue about "Why do I have to take off my jewelry?" And you think, "Lady, shut up." And then -- but I -- you know, like night I went to the Mets game, and they have a clear line there now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You just get in. And I like, I think that people should use it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but then if more people will use it, then you'd need another clear line.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Clearer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Clear-plus.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: You know when lines aren't bad? I was at Newark Airport and waiting in line, and Chris Hemsworth was right in front of me in the line, from "Thor."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Very handsome. And then the line was -- didn't matter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what that -- you know what you just told me? You told me that even Chris Hemsworth has to wait in line.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They're just like us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're just like us.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Go ahead. I didn't want to take Dana's.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. I'm going to go with when someone is playing their headphones louder than they should, and you can kind of hear their music but not really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Super annoying. Anybody who is eating things like sunflower seeds on a plane, absolutely not. That's absolutely bad form. And also, the other thing that annoys me -- and some people can't help it -- but the shaking of the leg up and down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because you're trying to read your book or do something. And the only thing you can see out of the corner of your eye is somebody's leg going like this. It dries me insane.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank God it's a leg. They will tell you, know what I hate? I'm going to tell you what I hate; I'm going to tell you what happened to me flying back from vacation. One, I don't like people taking off their shoes and socks.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Disgusting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Your feet are the least attractive part of your body. Also, OK, so I get -- I'm going on the plane with my wife, and we're not seated together, but we're seated in the same row. And so, I wait -- I wait for the guy to come and sit next to me and I go, "Hey, do you mind if -- do you mind if" -- I said, "Would you like a window seat so I could sit with my wife?" And he said, "No, I'm OK." And he sat down. And I look at Elena, and I go, "I'm sorry." And she goes and sits down. Then he goes, "Hey, I just want to let you know, huge fan of 'The Five.' I watch the show -- I watch the show every day."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "I love the show." And I'm going, "What a great fan." Actually, I kind of respect that. All right.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: I think the take-away is everyone is really easy to travel with.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not. I have very high standards.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what, though? Let me just throw something out. I thought of something worse, which is when they make you sit on the tarmac for three or four hours.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's awful. That's panicky. That's like being stuck in an elevator, a giant horizontal elevator with 300 strangers with their socks off. All right. Facebook question from Michael W.: "Baseball players have walkout music for when they walk out to the plate when they bat. What would your walkout song be when walking on the set?"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: "Boys of Summer." I love that song. God, I love that song.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's your answer to everything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Everything. I know. "Who do you hang out with?" "Boys of Summer."

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: It's nice to have a gander (ph) response.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All comes down to boys.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: I would do -- I would steal from the president and do "You Can't Always Get What You Want." I just think it -- I did it, actually, at a conference one time, because I just think it's hilarious that so many people dislike him, and he walks out --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I want to change mine. I want mine to be "Hail to the Chief."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: While you're in first class?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think, like, "Eye of the Tiger," or I like Bobby Brown's "My Prerogative." I just think that's a cool song.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Terrible person, though.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It just takes me back to when I was in third grade, and Josh Williams asked who high favorite band was, and I said REO Speedwagon, and he made so much fun of me, as if that was not a cool answer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What's his name?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Josh Williams.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I bet he's nobody now. And he probably watches you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He had an AC/DC shirt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, then he was probably pretty cool.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Maybe he was right. There's no comparison between AC/DC and REO Speedwagon.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I know. He thought I was kind of lame. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, now that he runs Goldman Sachs, I guess --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How about "You've Got to Know When to Hold 'em"?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a good laundry song. I would say coming out, I would do the theme to "Shaft." All right. Oh, OK, I'll be quick. "What's your funniest blooper," Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Here, when I got bleeped one time, because we were come -- Eric Holder was saying something in a sound bite, and I didn't know we were coming back to air.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I was saying something quite derogatory about the comment, and I got caught and I got bleeped. Like somebody else who used to be on this show. Only two people have ever been bleeped on this show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And you're one of them.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: And you were one of them?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This was off camera. I walked into a glass door today, bashed my head. You have to pull the security footage.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But you now, life is full of bloopers if that's a blooper.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: It's like every day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We meant TV, Juan. What's -- any blooper?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I mean, I say stupid things all the time. You know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know what? Your fans are going to agree with that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Lisa, any mistakes recently?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Well, like you try to say something and you forget, and then it's just silence.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean, did you hear her in the A-block?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, hey, slow down. She's a guest.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, all right. Mine was when I did a segment on "Red Eye" about circus peanuts. And that's all I'm going to say, because I didn't say it that way. "One More Thing," up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's time now for "One More Thing." That was like the best commercial break in a long time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That doesn't help people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My "One More Thing" is guess what? It's this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Guess what?

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Dana's Corny Jokes

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "Dana's Corny Joke of the Day." I've got to get my ear piece in here. Have you heard about the latest pirate movie?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Have you heard about the latest pirate movie?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Rated arrr!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: I love that Jesse gets it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I never get those.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What does the dune say to the ocean? What did the dune say to the ocean?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When are you coming over?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He said, "How you dune?"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Did I do it right? OK, I tried. What did the fish do during summer break? What did the fish do during summer break?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Pick up gills?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Nothing, they're always in school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Which letter is the coolest?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now I'm doing the alphabet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Which letter is the coolest? Iced T. And my last one: why did I stop searching for shellfish on the beach? Why did I stop searching for shellfish on the beach?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You got crabby? You got crabs?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: These are pretty hard.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I pulled a mussel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I liked "you got crabs" better.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Never mind. "The Greg Gutfeld Show," Saturday, 10 p.m. I've got Charles Hurt.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's on every single show today.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He's searing seersucker, by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, not tonight. Joe Mackey -- it's actually tomorrow night, 10 p.m. Kat Timpf, Tyrus, great show. Also my book tour starts. My book tour starts, I'll be beginning in August 4 in Texas. I'll be in Texas for a couple of days. I'll be New York, and I'll be in New Jersey. And where else will I be? I'll be in California. But I know you're going to love this, August 25, The Villages.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The Villages!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The Villages.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Awesome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Donald Trump meets the queen. Antifa clashes with ICE. And out-of-control road rage and surveillance video. "Watters' World," 8 p.m. Saturday night. I have the ladies, Diamond and Silk, Dr. Sebastian Gorka, Katie Pavlich, and Jillian Mele makes her "Watters' World" debut. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Juan Williams.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, one Arizona woman very lucky to be alive after she became trapped in her car, which plunged into a canal off a highway in Mesa. At first the rescuers in the water attempting to see if anyone is alive in the submerged vehicle. She then indicates no one's survived, but in a flash he sees or feels some movement. He then throws his keys to the shore and dives under the water.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The firefighter emerges with the woman in his arms.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Firefighters pulled the two onto land --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, bless her heart.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- and the woman in her 50s gasped for air. She's expected to be OK. Man, I've got to tell you, she better thank her lucky stars. That was an amazing rescue. Hats off to the fireman and everybody involved.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Lisa.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: Very scary. Well, GOP candidate Katie Arrington is back on the campaign trail. She, of course, got into a terrible car accident where the driver of a vehicle who was intoxicated sadly passed away. She damaged her vertebrae, lost her small intestine, lost her -- or most of her small intestine, lost her right colon, but she's back on the campaign trail. She says, "If anyone does not believe in God, look at me." Also, kudos to the Democratic candidate, who largely stayed off the campaign trail. That was a class act, and it's good to know that there are some classy people in politics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She's tough. And watch out. She's going to be a competitor. You have another question?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. This is Friday the 13th. What is your biggest superstition, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Pass, I'm going to come back to it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This isn't a game show?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't walk under ladders.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really? I have to do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's also for safety.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I guess I pick up pennies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really? You do?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. OK.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.sentences: I don't know if it's -- I pray before every show. I don't think that's a superstition.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow. Maybe I should try.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You should imagine what I have to do. It's unbelievable. It's unbelievable?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Greg, you have something?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't believe in superstitions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I say a wish if the clock is at 11:11.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't like superstitions. I'm very superstitious about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not superstitious in any way. Nor sentimental. Really, kind of -- I have no feelings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're a cold person.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a fun week. That's it for us. We'll see you on Monday. "Special Report" is up next. Here's a superstitious guy. Just kidding. utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Lisa Boothe, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is "The Five." President Trump is in the U.K. and already making waves holding a press conference with British Prime Minister Theresa May. The president downplaying the fallout of a controversial interview he gave to British newspaper, The Sun, where he accused May of wreaking Brexit and killing off any chance of a vital U.S. trade deal.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: I didn't criticize the prime minister. I have a lot of respect for the prime minister. And unfortunately, there was a story that was done, which was, you know, generally fine, but it didn't put in what I said about the prime minister and I've said tremendous things. It's called fake news. She's going to make a decision as to what she's going to do. The only thing I ask of Teresa is that we make sure we can trade, that we don't have any restrictions because we want to trade with the U.K., and the U.K. wants to trade with us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The president was met with thousands of protesters and a giant flying Trump baby blimp in London which he said made him feel unwelcome.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: It makes me feel unwelcome. No reason for me to go to London. I used to love London as a city, haven't been there for a long time. But when they make you feel unwelcome, why would I stay there?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One of the biggest issues angering demonstrators is Trump's tough stance on immigration, a subject he also broached during his press conference, warning Europe about the potential risks.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I think it's been very bad for Europe. I think Europe is a place I know very well. And I think that what has happened is very tough. It's a very tough situation. I mean, you see the same terror attacks that I do. I know it's politically not necessarily correct to say that, but I'll say it and I'll say it loud. And I think they better watch themselves.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Greg, you lived in the U.K. Let's start with London. It was amazing to me that that many people have the day off to just hang out and.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: On a Friday afternoon. The interesting thing, number one, is the balloon has absolutely no effect because Trump is actually bigger than the balloon. I mean, he actually is as a phenomenon, wherever he goes, has a greater impact than anything there. So he is the number one story in England. He's the biggest thing in England. He's bigger than Big Ben. I want to make a metaphor and analogy if I may to my friends in England, I live there, I'm an Anglo file, I love the music. In the 1970's, music was plagued by soft rock and progressive rock. Things like Air Supply, and Genesis, and Emerson, Lake & Palmer. Just really boring ponders music. Pop a song to a 15 minute drum solos. Then in 1976, the Ramones, the Ramones from New York, Queens. Queen went to England and played, and what happened? Destroyed that whole scene, and all these punk bands started, the Clash, the Daman, the Sex Pistols. Thousands of new band happened. Sound familiar? Donald Trump is the Ramones of politics. What he's done is what punk did to music, Trump is doing to the entire political scene. He's a brutal, blunt, game-changing, but he's elementally true. You may not like punk rock but the messages in the songs were truth. They were 3 minutes, 2 minutes of truth. That's what you're seeing. This is the first punk-rock president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is that the metaphor you said was going to blow our minds?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. In fact, I got it from a buddy of mine. My buddy Paul. He emailed me last night, said, you know, he's a punk-rock president, and I go yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Punk-rock president. I mean, I like the country music president, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You had one, it's G.W. Bush.

utterances.speaker: LISA BOOTHE, THE FIVE CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: He does kind of rage.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Rage against the machine, is true. You want to carry this metaphor forward?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I will, because I was actually thinking of something similar, because everyone focuses on the way President Trump says things, but the way he says it makes you focus on what he's saying. For instance, if President Trump hadn't said that Germany was held captive by Russia, we wouldn't be talking about something like the Nord Stream 2 pipeline, which is important because it does, in fact, give Russia leverage over Germany and other European nations. So it's something important, especially at a time, you know, when we're all talking about Russia aggression and we're looking at putting sanctions on Russia, sort of undercuts that narrative and that objective if they're funneling money to Russia through the pipeline. But we wouldn't be talking about it if he didn't say it that way. Or you look at immigration, all you have to do is look at the Paris attackers, the ease that they're able to get around Europe, go back to Syria, come back, hiding in places like Mozambique which are the epiphany of a failure of integration of immigration policy and lack of assimilation. So, I mean, he says these things at the face that seems outlandish, but would we be talking about the substance if he didn't say it that way?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know, actually, maybe, maybe not. I do -- I was just thinking though about the -- the Theresa May comment, Jesse. So he gave the interview to The Sun. They released the audio. He said it was fake, but I do think that he actually -- maybe felt a little bad that she felt slighted in her own paper while he was there.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I think he did feel bad, he felt a human emotion that is possible with this president. And lot of people thinks he's just this maniacal robot that doesn't care about people's feelings. But the way he was, kind of, over the top praising her as this strong, decisive ally that is a big winner.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And it might work out in her favor because now we're going to get a trade deal looks like.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly. I remember when President Obama said that, you know, if you guys do Brexit, you know, we're going to get in the back of the line on the trade. He's done the opposite and he's reached his arm across the Atlantic and offered an olive branch there. I thought meeting the queen was the bigger thing today, just the visual that was pumped into the world. And when we see this on television, people enjoy the spectacle of it, they like the red and the colors, and she's in the blue and the president's trying to walk like this, and it's just very formal, and it shows how the president was respected. I know the president personally enjoys that kind of pomp and circumstance. He enjoys the respect them rolling out the red carpet. But it really solidified the special relationship. Today, you also saw the image of him holding Theresa May's hand. And then they had tea with the queen. And he probably gave him a big boost of adrenaline at the end of this. At the end of it, when you look at it, the European countries did make commitments to boost their defense spending. And NATO is invigorated, I believe, and more focused on the task at hand, and on confronting Russia. So, I think at the end of the day, the trip to Europe was positive. And we've had great economic news this week, Strzok humiliated himself.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We're going to get to all that, Jesse. Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Wow. But I will say, I didn't anticipate-- I didn't anticipate Greg making the argument for immigration. We should send the kids from Queens over to London, why not, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It changed the world.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But Trump said that, in fact, these immigrants are tearing the fabric of Europe and London apart. And he goes after the mayor. And by the way, Jesse, he said that he loves Theresa May. You know what? He's the one that gave the interview. It's not like somebody forced him to talk to The Sun Newspaper. He gave an interview that was hostile toward a leader he was about to sit down. He created the chaos. He created the situation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. And then he created the making-up together.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Ultimately, Juan, that might work out in Theresa May's favor, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It could, but.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It put him a little bit on the defensive, and it put him in a position of being quite amiable. And so, because she was gracious, she said, oh, no problem, it's fine, like very British, you know, stiff up he lip, no problem. She's going to walk away with possibly getting a trade deal. Earlier in the week her government was falling apart.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I think Boris Johnson left. I don't know how close they are to actually falling apart. He said she's a strong leader. He wishes there are more leaders -- I don't know. But I will say, he goes over there, he stirs the pot, then he tries to un-stir the pot. Again, he is, you know, the be-all of the whole story. But, to me, you can't get over the fact that, one, 100,000 people in the streets of London? I mean, forget the crying babies.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Let me get Greg in here. The London protest -- as I saw Benjamin Hall, earlier, reporting at the 2 o'clock hour, was that they were really campaigning against capitalism.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's true. A lot of this -- this is what happens with left wing protesters, it's becomes a grab bag of everything. You saw women dressed up as characters from the Handmaid's Tale, which is the fictional miniseries about a misogynistic dystopia where women are forced into sexual slavery. Now, I doubt any of those women dressed up as those Handmaids ever did anything about the mass rape in England.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: In Birmingham?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. Isn't it Rotterdam? The sexual slavery that took place there was an absolutely scandal that went on for years, and I don't see any signs for that. But to Juan's point, everybody hates his style, everybody hates his style, that's why he's punk rock. But the New York Times even had to admit today, was it today's paper? The headline was Trump got everything Obama ever asked for.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't see that headline, but it sounds like a good one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not fake news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's one of the things in the New York Times I agree with.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think you guys understand, in a way, he's not even playing to the Europeans. He's not playing to Theresa May.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Everybody plays to their domestic audience.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. So he's playing to an American base, when he brings up immigration issue he's trying to stir that up here. I think he talks about terrorism. There's no truth -- are you kidding? Europe -- I mean, what did Theresa May say as she was standing there next to him? Immigration has been great for Great Britain, that's what she said.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But, Juan, all of it -- from Germany to Denmark to Sweden to all of these populace are rising up because of.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Correct. So I think he's playing to a populace, nationalist sentiment that he would like to excite here at home for the midterms. But that is not -- it's not the case that you are breaking apart Europe, and the fabric is being torn, and that the mayor of London is responsible for all those terrorism. I hope he says that with Vladimir Putin.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse, one of the signs that they had today that I thought was kind of preposterous, it says no to Trump, no to war. Like, what war? Like Trump is really not the war monger.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's the war on the press.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Someone today who said these are not, you know, the downtrodden, you know, lower class people that have been crushed by the industrial revolution. These are people name Alester that came from snobby backgrounds and went to nice prep schools, that can afford to take the Friday afternoon off.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. The dust is still settling on Capitol Hill after an explosive public hearing with anti-Trump FBI agent, Peter Strzok. This, as his lover, Lisa Page, is question behind closed doors today, all the developments, next.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: I would call it the witch hunt. I would call it the rigged witch hunt after watching some of the little clips. I didn't get to watch too much because I'm here. It's a different time zone to put it mildly. But after watching the people, that man that was testifying yesterday, I call it the rigged witch hunt.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was the president earlier reacting to yesterday's house hearing with anti-Trump FBI agent, Peter Strzok, a key player in the Hillary Clinton e-mail and Russian investigations. The president's comments came just moments before Robert Mueller indicted 12 Russian officers for election meddling. As you know, yesterday's hearing was contentious, ugly and fiery, and Republicans and Democrats still going at it.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: We won't get justice from the Democrats. If you watched the hearing today, you saw the Democrats give a five-hour cat bath to Peter Strzok.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The Republicans did not show up yesterday to hear the answers. They wanted to use the questions to undermine Bob Mueller's investigation. This is all an effort to protect the president.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You actually had a Democrat say that because Strzok was testifying and we were asking hard questions that he deserved a purple heart. I mean, how absurd can you be to say, suggest something like that.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I think the Republicans acted like the defense team of Donald Trump. And I'm sure the Kremlin is very, very happy.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I think it just shows how much they hate Donald Trump. This is a guy who's been demoted by the FBI, who's been criticized by the FBI director, by the inspector general. Demoted to the human resources and is under investigation for an ethics review.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This was clearly a show put on by the Republicans.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I think we're really being distracted by this hearing. And I think that was probably the main purpose to try to raise questions, again, about the Mueller investigation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Meanwhile, former FBI attorney, Lisa Page, meeting with congressional investigators behind closed doors after initially defying a subpoena to answer questions about her text message exchanges trashing Trump. All right, Greg, the dust has settled after yesterday's hearing. Now how do you feel about it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everyone -- I know people are going to get mad, everyone there was obnoxious, everybody on both sides. What bothered me were the self- appointed white knights of the Democrats rushing to defend Strzok as if he was a princess stuck in high dungeon. Then there was the Republicans showboating to a point where they actually turned him into Oliver North. But, first you had the Democrats offering Strzok more cover than an oversized straw hat. And then you had the Republicans constantly trying to pull off the oversized straw hat. It drove me crazy. But the thing is, the point of this whole hearing is there's nothing you're going to get out of talking to Strzok, because accusing somebody of bias in 2016 is like accusing someone of being high at Woodstock. We were all biased. I know I was. I mean, we've had some serious fights here. Everybody had strong feelings. And I know you're going to say, but he was an FBI agent, he's in charge of investigation, but you can't prove that his bias affected that. You can believe it, I believe it, but I can't prove it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Very difficult to prove.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And the inspector general said that very thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's obvious, looks like this -- obviously looks like bias, but I can't say that there was any action that he took that was because of it. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you think there's anything substantive to come out of this hearing that people can sink their teeth into?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that if there were we would be talking about it. OK. So, I think that what happened is this drove partisans on both sides to their deepest, darkest corners. No new info. No minds change. And Strzok was quite smug and arrogant. And why they didn't just let him be that way instead of making themselves look horrible. That's what everybody is talking about.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Gee, how did Louie Gohmert make Republican look horrible yesterday?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've already said it yesterday. And there's plenty of press about that today.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I mean, I was thinking it was way rude to somehow try to shame him for his affair, and then bring his wife -- I mean, it's just awful.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've already said that yesterday.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I'm just telling you today, because I think that you're asking about today and the impact it had. So, the key point yesterday was let's -- from the Republican perspective, let's prove that this man was so biased that the entire investigation into Trump is, in fact, useless, that you can't honestly judge what happened if the Russian interference and potential collusion because of Peter Strzok's behavior. In fact, what it revealed, if you want a news headline from yesterday, was there was no such plot to undermine Trump. That he could have come out with news about the Russian investigation, he didn't do it.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: No, no, no.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: People keep saying this, and I think that's actually incorrect. Hillary Clinton was under a criminal investigation because there was enough evidence of potential wrongdoing to have a criminal investigation by the FBI. The Russia investigation was a counter intelligence investigation, largely looking at a foreign power, potentially involved in, or elections, two entirely different things. Again, Comey told President Trump when he was first elected, three different times, he wasn't under investigation. So, no, those aren't two of the same things.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I hate when people say that because it's not true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me respond to you. What you have now is a situation where Mike Flynn and others in the Trump campaign, in fact, have either plead guilty, or today as we saw in terms of the indictment, you see people who are reaching out. Now, Rod Rosenstein today said nobody on the American side may have been aware of the efforts by these Russians. But what you have, Lisa, is today with the indictment, I think it was 12 today, you have 13 indicted in February, it's clear there was Russian interference ongoing. And the effort by people like.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: The point is, Hillary Clinton was the subject of criminal investigation is different.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Yes, it is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because it was an ongoing investigation being run by the FBI. And guess who was in charge? Peter Strzok. But the big point for me is, here you get President Trump today, saying, oh, I guess I'll bring it up with Putin on Monday. But there was no Perry -- there's not going to be any Perry Mason moment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Let's get someone else in here. To your point, Juan-- I mean, at that point in the Hillary deal, she had already set up a private server against the law, and then shredded all the emails. So there was, obviously.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Get out of here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: . evidence of wrongdoing. They started this counter intelligence investigation with no evidence of.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Why don't you go all the way back to Benghazi?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: . any evidence of wrongdoing. But let's talk about the indictment.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, you bring this up. So why don't you go back to -- all you want to do is talk about Hillary Clinton because you don't want to talk about.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You want to talk about Hillary Clinton. But what strikes me is, if you look at those Strzok e-mails, I'm amazed. Strzok's going after Eric Holder. He's going after Chelsea Clinton. He's going after the Democrats. And yet, for one comment about Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's more than one, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can I wrap this up with a contrast? Compare the NATO summit to what we saw yesterday. You have a shouting mass of hysterics of establishment politicians, and you have this lone singular person who actually gets crap done.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I can't wrap my head around congress having a 10 percent approval rating.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, who are these 10 percent?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. The University of Wyoming new cowboy slogan gets wrangled up in the heat of controversy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Terrible.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The uproar when we return.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my. The P.C. police at it again, this time in the cowboy state. A new marketing slogan at the University of Wyoming, which says, quote, the world needs more cowboys, end quote. Well, it's getting a backlash. The phrase sparking outrage from some faculty and Native American groups, they claim it's sexist and racist because it excludes women and people of color. The university defending the slogan saying their cowboys are diverse. We now go to our local cowgirl, Dana Perino.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, yeah, this is ridiculous. So, my dad went to University of Wyoming, proud cowboy. Liz Cheney's daughter, I don't know if that's allowed -- am I allowed to say that? But, anyway, she just got into the school and she's going to be on the rodeo team which is very exciting. I do like it that the board of trustees unanimously rejected this nonsense, that I do think this is proof that the world actually does need more cowboys because it's preposterous. And, the other thing is, when you are a part of a school, they say the world needs more cowboys, or they say where did you go to school, what was the mascot?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The bantams.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The bantams. OK. Were there male bantams and female bantam? I mean, it's just the bantams. So you are a cowboy if you go to the school, that's what it is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, actually.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like the wolverines.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: . they had a good response, which was that they like the idea that if people respond to cowboys as John Wayne and the Marlboro man, you know, white males, that they would be surprised if they opened up and realized that, hey, there're women, there're people of color, Native Americans, blacks, et cetera. And that the contrast then would say, hey, there's a different reality to the University of Wyoming. Do you think that sells, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think it sells, but I think it's simpler when you just say this is a place for cowboys. That why slogans work. You don't say this is the place where there's cowboys, cowgirls, minority cowboys, cowpersons and Indians. That's just can't even fit on a brochure. I also don't understand, like, you can't say Indians can't be a mascot and cowboys can't be a mascot. What does that leave you? Who else was on the prairie?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Laura Ingalls.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You have to have something. I just think people are soft in this country. And if you get offended or can't handle the mascot at the university you go to, you're weak. And you're not going to cut it in the real world.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, it's right.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Everybody can be a cowboy -- it's just so stupid. And my broader concern, as you've mentioned, the weakness of society because we're not building future generations of leaders. I mean, what General Mattis is or walking around college campuses when you're taught to not be able to tolerate people with different opinions, different races, you shut people down that, you know, look at life in a different way than you. How do you ever going to go out into the real world and face reality? Or even -- how are we breeding the next generation of leaders when everyone is so soft and weak.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second, so here's the contrary thought. The contrary thought would be you don't want a slogan that makes people feel excluded.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Oh, Juan. You can be a cowboy. I can be a cowboy. Jesse is a cowboy. Dana is a cowboy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know it excludes all the people that aren't in the university. That's the deal. When you have a mascot at the university, you rally around the mascot.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm all for it, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Very -- it's an easy solution. You change the name to bovine administrator. How does that work? I would be -- that is, to me -- I came up with that today. Are you sure this story wasn't concocted in an underwater lab by Brian Kilmeade and Steve Doocy for "FOX & Friends"? Because this is the absolute perfect epitome of the outrage story. And actually, it's true, and it comes down to a simple equation that we're running into now every single day. Do you change everything in life to satisfy a tiny, tiny block of people who are only demanding these changes for an exercise in domination? Right? Because you know that changing "cowboy" to "bovine administrator" is not going to improve your life as an activist or a social justice warrior. It's not actually going to do anything to your life. So this is about pure attention-seeking behavior. So you're sniffing constantly for some kind of vulnerability where you can say, "Aha! You are an oppressor. You must change now!" And that's what this is about.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it's never going to be good enough.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, and more people have to be like this college and say, "We're willing to risk the slings and arrows of an angry, tiny percentage of people. Grow up." By the way, what --

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: It was unanimous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. That means everyone, by the way.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: no, no. That means everyone on the board.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But it doesn't mean that prospective students -- and believe me, the reason they're having this marketing campaign is to bring in more people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Great, well, knock yourselves out. There's lots of colleges.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They don't want -- they don't want people coming from other parts of the country to say, "Oh --"

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If you're going to go -- if you're applying to the University of Wyoming, I'm pretty sure you know what you're getting.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, but the hope is --

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: You -- you probably don't have that big a problem in life if this is what you're stewing over. I mean, come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, no, the people that think about this do have huge problems. It's called identity politics, and it's destroying their careers and futures.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And they're coming after people who are useful and productive in society. We have to worry about this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everybody -- people are losing their jobs --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- because they step on the wrong little land mine.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, I think the identity politics worry here is the exact opposite, that you can have a broader identity for the cowboy, which is what I think some people here are saying, than simply the Marlboro man. And people wanted to do that. I don't see anything wrong --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Monday we'll talk about the Marlboro man.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. Outrage -- yes, more outrage for you -- after Forbes calls reality TV star Kylie Jenner one of America's richest -- and this is the controversial part -- self-made woman. That's next, for your fun on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. Is this what self-made looks like? Backlash is brewing after the latest Forbes cover, touting reality TV star Kylie Jenner as, quote, "set to be to be the youngest-ever self-made billionaire." Some are crying foul, claiming she's obviously had help from her famous family, the Kardashian-Jenner clan. Dictionary.com even got in on it, tweeting, "Self-made means having succeeded in life unaided." And one Twitter user writes, "Calling Kylie Jenner a self- made billionaire is like claiming you made soup from scratch because you opened a can and reheated it." All right. Everybody loves a good pull-yourself-up-from-the-boot-straps story. But Greg, is Kylie Jenner self-made?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know -- I don't know if that's the problem. I think this should be -- the big problem -- the big message here is that she owns what she does. And this is something that I -- you know, everybody should be thinking about when they're young. Even if you're in your 30s or your 40s, you still have four to five decades left on this planet. You should own something. If it doesn't grow, you had the pleasure of owning it. And if it does grow, you can get rich. She's aspirational for so many young people to turn your hobby or your love into an occupation because you have the Internet. You can open up a store front. If you have -- if you're interested in a certain product or thing, you can make it your own. And if you don't make any money it's still your hobby. But if you make money, you make money. So I think this is -- I think a lot of people are, you know, making fun of her. I think it's kind of -- it's pretty cool. She's majoring -- she majored in herself. She's the CEO of her own person.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: And, Dana, so -- OK, so three years, she's made $900 million. That's a lot of money. She owns 100 percent of the business.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Does not own -- if this criticism fair?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Not necessarily. I think a little bit of it is probably jealousy. And of course -- like, it would be even more impressive if she had been born with zero.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And her parents never helped her, and she didn't have famous sisters and stuff. But I think in today's world, I mean, how many people -- like, my dad helped me find, like, a summer job at a place where I worked in an office, and I worked my way up. How many people that you interview today it's because your friend's daughter really needs a job and then something -- Everybody is helping somebody else out. She just happened to make a lot of money that way.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Well, and Jesse, the Fat Jewish -- that's his name -- from Instagram, just so people say that, he's -- he's starting a GoFundMe page to raise the additional $100 million. It's obviously a joke and to get attention, and it's working. But, Jesse, what do you make of all this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm self-made. I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Think about it. I started as a production assistant here.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Yes, actually, that's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And now I'm on "The Five." So I didn't have any help from anybody. People tried to keep me down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. No, no, no. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, listen, she's really attractive, that's the key. She had a sister who got famous for you know what. And then she capitalized on that. She's got a famous name, famous family. She's obviously got business savvy, because these product lines, or the makeup lines, whatever it is, are incredible. And people admire her. So I have a lot of respect for her. And, you know, if she wants to share some of that fortune, I'm all here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I could see that pairing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, this is (UNINTELLIGIBLE) for you.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Juan, I'm sure you follow the Jenner-Kardashian group. What do you think of all of this?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think it's hilarious. I mean, first of all, maybe you guys can answer a question for me. Why are these people famous other than.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I don't think you don't want to us to get into that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean, I don't have any idea. But I think that then somebody comes out with anything. It didn't have to be cosmetics. It could have been clothing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It could have been cars. I don't know. And then everybody sells it on the basis of the name. So to somehow give her credit I don't understand Forbes. Because I read Forbes. I think it's a serious magazine. But to say self-made, I think, boy, talk about privileged. That's privileged. That's family wealth connection. And a mom who is an absolute shark when it comes to business. So, I don't -- I mean, I think maybe you should have put the mother on the cover not her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm sure she probably had been.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Good point.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Well, and the mom, I guess, made -- has made $17 million already off of the makeup line. But you know, Jesse, if someone else's name was on the cover and they used the term "self-made" in the same reference --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I think whoever said it was jealousy. People want to hate her, because she looks really good on Instagram. I mean, she photographs really well. She's got tons of fans online. And all these young women want to be here and look like her. And she's done really well --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's the bad news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- selling that look.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, the good -- this is --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's the bad news.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- telling people what to do with -- you don't to have go to college, all right? There are other options in this world.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And social media and the Internet, as bad as they are, is offering opportunities for people to say, "You know what? I'm going to -- I like doing X, so I'm going to concentrate on X. And in fact, I don't need to go to college." I think this is inspirational.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, I think it's destructive, if that's the lesson. Because I think the odds still are, in America, get the college degree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, and have tons -- have tons of college debt. The average 21- year-old is in total debt. She could pay off their debt.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: LeBron didn't go to college, and he's worth, what --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Become a basketball player.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, can you or I play basketball like LeBron?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, and we don't look like her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Lisa, power through.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: We've got to go. Thank you, Dana, for saying that. All right. Up next the segment that you will love, "Fan Mail Friday" on "The Five." Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, we're going to polka through the summer. I'm back from vacation, tanned, rejuvenated and ready for some "Fan Mail Friday." OK. Ooh, this is a good one from @French12871. That's his actual name. Interesting, isn't it, Twitter? "What annoys you the most when you are flying" -- Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow, I have a lot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. That's why you're going last.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't like not flying first class. It's hard to go from first class and then go back to coach. You have to admit that's true.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Back with the peasants?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, I don't like when people kick the back of my seat. You know, I don't like when the bathroom is occupied and I have to go. I mean, there's a lot I don't like.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It can go on forever.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean, just from the start, I don't like the lines. So the security lines, especially, like if it's holiday and you get a lot of people who aren't regular fliers. And they just stand there, like, they want to argue about "Why do I have to take off my jewelry?" And you think, "Lady, shut up." And then -- but I -- you know, like night I went to the Mets game, and they have a clear line there now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You just get in. And I like, I think that people should use it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but then if more people will use it, then you'd need another clear line.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Clearer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Clear-plus.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: You know when lines aren't bad? I was at Newark Airport and waiting in line, and Chris Hemsworth was right in front of me in the line, from "Thor."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Very handsome. And then the line was -- didn't matter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what that -- you know what you just told me? You told me that even Chris Hemsworth has to wait in line.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're just like us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're just like us.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Go ahead. I didn't want to take Dana's.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. I'm going to go with when someone is playing their headphones louder than they should, and you can kind of hear their music but not really?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Super annoying. Anybody who is eating things like sunflower seeds on a plane, absolutely not. That's absolutely bad form. And also, the other thing that annoys me -- and some people can't help it -- but the shaking of the leg up and down.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because you're trying to read your book or do something. And the only thing you can see out of the corner of your eye is somebody's leg going like this. It dries me insane.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank God it's a leg. They will tell you, know what I hate? I'm going to tell you what I hate; I'm going to tell you what happened to me flying back from vacation. One, I don't like people taking off their shoes and socks.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Disgusting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Your feet are the least attractive part of your body. Also, OK, so I get -- I'm going on the plane with my wife, and we're not seated together, but we're seated in the same row. And so, I wait -- I wait for the guy to come and sit next to me and I go, "Hey, do you mind if -- do you mind if" -- I said, "Would you like a window seat so I could sit with my wife?" And he said, "No, I'm OK." And he sat down. And I look at Elena, and I go, "I'm sorry." And she goes and sits down. Then he goes, "Hey, I just want to let you know, huge fan of 'The Five.' I watch the show -- I watch the show every day."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "I love the show." And I'm going, "What a great fan." Actually, I kind of respect that. All right.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I think the take-away is everyone is really easy to travel with.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm not. I have very high standards.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what, though? Let me just throw something out. I thought of something worse, which is when they make you sit on the tarmac for three or four hours.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's awful. That's panicky. That's like being stuck in an elevator, a giant horizontal elevator with 300 strangers with their socks off.

utterances.speaker: All right. Facebook question from Michael W.
utterances.utterance: "Baseball players have walkout music for when they walk out to the plate when they bat. What would your walkout song be when walking on the set?"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "Boys of Summer." I love that song. God, I love that song.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's your answer to everything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everything. I know. "Who do you hang out with?" "Boys of Summer."

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: It's nice to have a gander (ph) response.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All comes down to boys.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I would do -- I would steal from the president and do "You Can't Always Get What You Want." I just think it -- I did it, actually, at a conference one time, because I just think it's hilarious that so many people dislike him, and he walks out --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I want to change mine. I want mine to be "Hail to the Chief."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: While you're in first class?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think, like, "Eye of the Tiger," or I like Bobby Brown's "My Prerogative." I just think that's a cool song.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Terrible person, though.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It just takes me back to when I was in third grade, and Josh Williams asked who high favorite band was, and I said REO Speedwagon, and he made so much fun of me, as if that was not a cool answer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's his name?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Josh Williams.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I bet he's nobody now. And he probably watches you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He had an AC/DC shirt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, then he was probably pretty cool.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe he was right. There's no comparison between AC/DC and REO Speedwagon.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know. He thought I was kind of lame. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, now that he runs Goldman Sachs, I guess --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How about "You've Got to Know When to Hold 'em"?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a good laundry song. I would say coming out, I would do the theme to "Shaft." All right. Oh, OK, I'll be quick. "What's your funniest blooper," Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Here, when I got bleeped one time, because we were come -- Eric Holder was saying something in a sound bite, and I didn't know we were coming back to air.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I was saying something quite derogatory about the comment, and I got caught and I got bleeped. Like somebody else who used to be on this show. Only two people have ever been bleeped on this show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And you're one of them.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: And you were one of them?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This was off camera. I walked into a glass door today, bashed my head. You have to pull the security footage.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But you now, life is full of bloopers if that's a blooper.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: It's like every day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We meant TV, Juan. What's -- any blooper?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I mean, I say stupid things all the time. You know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know what? Your fans are going to agree with that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lisa, any mistakes recently?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Well, like you try to say something and you forget, and then it's just silence.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, did you hear her in the A-block?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, hey, slow down. She's a guest.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, all right. Mine was when I did a segment on "Red Eye" about circus peanuts. And that's all I'm going to say, because I didn't say it that way. "One More Thing," up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "One More Thing." That was like the best commercial break in a long time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That doesn't help people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: My "One More Thing" is guess what? It's this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Guess what?

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: Dana's Corny Jokes

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: "Dana's Corny Joke of the Day." I've got to get my ear piece in here. Have you heard about the latest pirate movie?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Have you heard about the latest pirate movie?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Rated arrr!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I love that Jesse gets it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I never get those.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What does the dune say to the ocean? What did the dune say to the ocean?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When are you coming over?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He said, "How you dune?"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Did I do it right? OK, I tried. What did the fish do during summer break? What did the fish do during summer break?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Pick up gills?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Nothing, they're always in school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Which letter is the coolest?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now I'm doing the alphabet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Which letter is the coolest? Iced T.

utterances.speaker: And my last one
utterances.utterance: why did I stop searching for shellfish on the beach? Why did I stop searching for shellfish on the beach?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You got crabby? You got crabs?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: These are pretty hard.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I pulled a mussel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I liked "you got crabs" better.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Never mind. "The Greg Gutfeld Show," Saturday, 10 p.m. I've got Charles Hurt.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's on every single show today.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's searing seersucker, by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, not tonight. Joe Mackey -- it's actually tomorrow night, 10 p.m. Kat Timpf, Tyrus, great show. Also my book tour starts. My book tour starts, I'll be beginning in August 4 in Texas. I'll be in Texas for a couple of days. I'll be New York, and I'll be in New Jersey. And where else will I be? I'll be in California. But I know you're going to love this, August 25, The Villages.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The Villages!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The Villages.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Awesome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Donald Trump meets the queen. Antifa clashes with ICE. And out-of-control road rage and surveillance video. "Watters' World," 8 p.m. Saturday night. I have the ladies, Diamond and Silk, Dr. Sebastian Gorka, Katie Pavlich, and Jillian Mele makes her "Watters' World" debut. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Juan Williams.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, one Arizona woman very lucky to be alive after she became trapped in her car, which plunged into a canal off a highway in Mesa. At first the rescuers in the water attempting to see if anyone is alive in the submerged vehicle. She then indicates no one's survived, but in a flash he sees or feels some movement. He then throws his keys to the shore and dives under the water.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The firefighter emerges with the woman in his arms.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Firefighters pulled the two onto land --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, bless her heart.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- and the woman in her 50s gasped for air. She's expected to be OK. Man, I've got to tell you, she better thank her lucky stars. That was an amazing rescue. Hats off to the fireman and everybody involved.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Lisa.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Very scary. Well, GOP candidate Katie Arrington is back on the campaign trail. She, of course, got into a terrible car accident where the driver of a vehicle who was intoxicated sadly passed away. She damaged her vertebrae, lost her small intestine, lost her -- or most of her small intestine, lost her right colon, but she's back on the campaign trail. She says, "If anyone does not believe in God, look at me." Also, kudos to the Democratic candidate, who largely stayed off the campaign trail. That was a class act, and it's good to know that there are some classy people in politics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She's tough. And watch out. She's going to be a competitor. You have another question?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. This is Friday the 13th. What is your biggest superstition, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Pass, I'm going to come back to it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This isn't a game show?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't walk under ladders.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really? I have to do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's also for safety.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I guess I pick up pennies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really? You do?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. OK.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I don't know if it's -- I pray before every show. I don't think that's a superstition.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow. Maybe I should try.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You should imagine what I have to do. It's unbelievable. It's unbelievable?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Greg, you have something?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't believe in superstitions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I say a wish if the clock is at 11:11.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't like superstitions. I'm very superstitious about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm not superstitious in any way. Nor sentimental. Really, kind of -- I have no feelings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're a cold person.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a fun week. That's it for us. We'll see you on Monday. "Special Report" is up next. Here's a superstitious guy. Just kidding.
